newsitem.title: INDIA: India approves Kellogg proposal to increase stake.
newsitem.headline: India approves Kellogg proposal to increase stake.

text.p: India on Wednesday approved a proposal of the U.S.-based Kellogg Corp to invest $12.57 million in foreign direct investment in a fully owned subsidiary, the Industry Ministry said.
The proposal is to make breakfast cereals in India.
Kellogg's had said earlier in March that it would launch its Frosted Flakes brand in India under the name "Kellogg's Frosties."
Kellogg's Frosted Flakes is marketed in about 50 countries.
